AdvancedMode.Info.Available: this dialog has an advanced / debug mode for power-users - read more 2sxc.org/help?tag=debug-mode
Content.Export.Fields.Language.Label: Languages
Content.Export.Fields.LanguageReferences: Keep references to other languages (for re-import)
Content.Export.Fields.RecordExport.Label: Export data
Content.Export.Fields.RecordExport.Optio: No, just export blank data schema (for new data import)
Content.Export.Fields.ResourcesReference: Keep references (for re-import, for example Page:4711)
Replace references with real URLs (for example /Portals/0...)
Content.Export.Help: This will generate an XML file which you can edit in Excel. If you just want to import new data, use this to export the schema that you can then fill in using Excel. Please visit http://2sxc.org/help for more instructions.
Content.Export.Title: Export Content / Data

Content.Import.Evaluation.Detail.Entitie: If you press Import, it will:
Content.Import.Evaluation.Detail.Title: Try to import file '{{filename}}'
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.2: Document is not a valid XML file.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.3: Selected content-type does not match the content-type in the XML file.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.5: The document does not specify all languages for all entities.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.6: Language reference cannot be parsed, the language is not supported.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.7: Language reference cannot be parsed, the read-write protection is not supported.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Codes.8: Value cannot be read, because of it has an invalid format.
Content.Import.Evaluation.Error.Title: Try to import file '{{filename}}'
Content.Import.Fields.ClearEntities.Opti: Remove all entities not found in import
Keep all entities not found in import
Content.Import.Fields.File.Label: Choose file
Content.Import.Fields.ResourcesReference: Import links as written in the file (for example /Portals/...)
Try to resolve pathes to references
Content.Import.Help: This will import content-items into 2sxc. It requires that you already defined the content-type before you try importing, and that you created the import-file using the template provided by the Export. Please visit http://2sxc.org/help for more instructions.
Content.Import.Messages.BackupContentBef: Remember to backup your DNN first!
Content.Import.Messages.ImportCanTakeSom: Note: The import validates much data and may take several minutes.

ContentTypeEdit.Title: Edit Content Type
ContentTypes.Buttons.ChangeScopeQuestion: This is an advanced feature to show content-types of another scope. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing, as content-types of other scopes are usually hidden for a good reason.
ContentTypes.Messages.SharedDefinition: this content-type shares the definition of #{{SharedDefId}} so you can't edit it here - read 2sxc.org/help?tag=shared-types
ContentTypes.Messages.TypeOwn: this is an own content-type, it does not use the definition of another content-type - read 2sxc.org/help?tag=shared-types
ContentTypes.Messages.TypeShared: this content-type inherits the definition of #{{SharedDefId}} - read 2sxc.org/help?tag=shared-types
ContentTypes.Title: Content-Types and Data
ContentTypes.TypesTable.Name: Name
DataType.All.Title: General Settings
DataType.Custom.Explanation: use for things like gps-pickers (which writes into multiple fields) or for custom-data which serializes something exotic into the db like an array, a custom json or anything
DataType.DateTime.Explanation: for date, time or combined values
DataType.Hyperlink.Explanation: hyperlink or reference to a picture / file
